		buildAvatar (line 668)
	
 
	
	

Returns user's avatar


Returns user's avatar

	
    
				
  • return: HTML
    • 
				
  • since: 2.0
    • 
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		string
		
			buildAvatar
		
					([mixed $member_key = null], [bool $no_cache = 0], [bool $overRide = 0])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				mixed
				$member_key: [Optional] Member key: Either ID or email address                      If omitted then the current member id will be used			
    • 
					
  • 
				bool
				$no_cache: Whether to avoid caching			
    • 
					
  • 
				bool
				$overRide: Whether to show avatar even if view_avs is off for member			
    •

		checkNameExists (line 162)
	
 
	
	

Check for an existing display or user name


Check for an existing display or user name

	
    
				
  • return: Either an exception or ( true if name exists. False if name DOES NOT exist ) Error Codes: NO_PERMISSION        This user cannot change their display name at all NO_MORE_CHANGES        The user cannot change their display name again in this time period NO_NAME                No display name (or shorter than 3 chars was given) ILLEGAL_CHARS        The display name contains illegal characters
    • 
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		mixed
		
			checkNameExists
		
					(string $name, [array $member = array()], [string $field = 'members_display_name'], [bool $ignore = false], [bool $cleaned = false])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				string
				$name: Name to check			
    • 
					
  • 
				array
				$member: [ Optional Member Array ]			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$field: name or members_display_name			
    • 
					
  • 
				bool
				$ignore: Ignore display name changes check (e.g. for registration)			
    • 
					
  • 
				bool
				$cleaned: Do not clean name again (e.g. coming from cleanAndCheckName)			
    •

		fullCreateMember (line 402)
	
 
	
	

Create new member Very basic functionality at this point.


Create new member Very basic functionality at this point.

	
    
				
  • return: Final member Data including member_id
 Options aviable for the members table
   members_l_username   joined   email   member_group_id   ip_address   members_created_remote   member_login_key   member_login_key_expire   view_sigs   email_pm   view_img   view_avs   restrict_post   view_pop   msg_count_total   msg_count_new   msg_show_notification   coppa_user   auto_track   last_visit   last_activity   language   members_editor_choice   members_pass_salt   members_pass_hash   members_display_name   members_l_display_name   fb_uid   fb_emailhash   members_seo_name   bw_is_spammer
 EXCEPTION CODES CUSTOM_FIELDS_EMPTY    - Custom fields were not populated CUSTOM_FIELDS_INVALID  - Custom fields were invalid CUSTOM_FIELDS_TOOBIG   - Custom fields too big
    • 
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		array
		
			fullCreateMember
		
					([array $tables = array()], [bool $autoCreateName = FALSE], [bool $bypassCfields = FALSE])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				array
				$tables: Fields to save in the following format: array( 'members'      => array( 'email'     => 'test@test.com',                                                                                         'joined'   => time() ),                                                               'extendedProfile' => array( 'signature' => 'My signature' ) );                    Tables: members, pfields_content, profile_portal.                    You can also use the aliases: 'core [members]', 'extendedProfile [profile_portal]', and 'customFields [pfields_content]'			
    • 
					
  • 
				bool
				$autoCreateName: Flag to attempt to auto create a name if the desired is taken			
    • 
					
  • 
				bool
				$bypassCfields: Bypass custom field saving (if using the sso session integration this is required as member object isn't ready yet)			
    •

		load (line 469)
	
 
	
	

Load member


Load member

	
    
				
  • return: Array containing member data 
    1.  # Single member
      2. 

    2.  $member = IPSMember::load( 1, 'extendedProfile,groups' );
      3. 

    3.  $member = IPSMember::load( 'matt@email.com', 'all' );
      4. 

    4.  $member = IPSMember::load( 'MattM', 'all', 'displayname' ); // Can also use 'username', 'email' or 'id'
      5. 

    5.  # Multiple members
      6. 

    6.  $members = IPSMember::load( array( 1, 2, 10 ), 'all' );
      7. 

    7.  $members = IPSMember::load( array( 'MattM, 'JoeD', 'DaveP' ), 'all', 'displayname );
      8. 

    • 
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		array
		
			load
		
					([string $member_key = ''], [string $extra_tables = 'all'], [string $key_type = ''])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				string
				$member_key: [Optional] Member key: Either ID or email address OR array of IDs when $key_type is either ID or not set OR a list of $key_type strings (email address, name, etc)                  If omitted then the current member id will be used			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$extra_tables: Extra tables to load(all, none or comma delisted tables) Tables: members, pfields_content, profile_portal, groups, sessions, core_item_markers_storage.                    You can also use the aliases: 'extendedProfile', 'customFields' and 'itemMarkingStorage'			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$key_type: Key type. Leave it blank to auto-detect or specify "id", "email", "username", "displayname".			
    • 
				

		
			
	




	
	

		querySpamService (line 772)
	
 
	
	

Sends a query to the IPS Spam Service


Sends a query to the IPS Spam Service

	
    
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		string
		
			querySpamService
		
					(string $email, [string $ip = ''], [string $type = 'register'], [ $test = 0])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				string
				$email: Email address to check/report			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$ip: [$ip]        IP Address to check report, ipsRegistry::member()->ip_address will be used if the address is not specified			
    • 
					
  • 
				string
				$type: [$type]        Either register or markspam, register is default			
    • 
					
  • 
				
				$test			
    • 
				

		
			
	




	
	

		remove (line 487)
	
 
	
	

Delete member(s)


Delete member(s)

	
    
				
  • return: Action completed successfully
    • 
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		boolean
		
			remove
		
					([mixed $id = 0], [boolean $check_admin = true])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				mixed
				$id: [Integer] member ID or [Array] array of member ids			
    • 
					
  • 
				boolean
				$check_admin: Check if request is from an admin

		save (line 430)
	
 
	
	

Save member


Save member

	
    
				
  • return: True if the save was successful
 Exception Error Codes: NO_DATA           : No data to save NO_VALID_KEY    : No valid key to save NO_AUTO_LOAD    : Could not autoload the member as she does not exist INCORRECT_TABLE : Table one is attempting to save to does not exist NO_MEMBER_GROUP_ID: Member group ID is in the array but blank
    • 
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		boolean
		
			save
		
					([int $member_key = ''], [array $save = array()])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				int
				$member_key: [Optional] Member key: Either Array, ID or email address. If it's an array, it must be in the format:                     array( 'core' => array( 'field' => 'member_id', 'value' => 1 ) ) - useful for passing custom fields through                   If omitted then the current member id will be used			
    • 
					
  • 
				array
				$save: Fields to save in the following format: array( 'members'      => array( 'email'     => 'test@test.com',                                                                                         'joined'   => time() ),                                                               'extendedProfile' => array( 'signature' => 'My signature' ) );                    Tables: members, pfields_content, profile_portal.                    You can also use the aliases: 'core [members]', 'extendedProfile [profile_portal]', and 'customFields [pfields_content]'			
    • 
				

		
			
	




	
	

		saveNewAvatar (line 304)
	
 
	
	

Saves the member's avatar


Saves the member's avatar

	
    
				
  • return: Boolean value if the $this->returnAsBool is true or the error message thrown                              or the array of the avatar information updated
    • 
				
  • author: Brandon Farber, Stolen By Matt 'Haxor' Mecham <code> Excepton Codes: NO_MEMBER_ID:                A valid member ID was not passed. NO_PERMISSION:                You do not have permission to change the avatar UPLOAD_NO_IMAGE:                Nothing to upload UPLOAD_INVALID_FILE_EXT:        Incorrect file extension (not an image) UPLOAD_TOO_LARGE:            Upload is larger than allowed UPLOAD_CANT_BE_MOVED:        Upload cannot be moved into the uploads directory UPLOAD_NOT_IMAGE:            Upload is not an image, despite what the file extension says! NO_AVATAR_TO_SAVE:            Nothing to save! </code>
    • 
				
  • access: public
    •

		uploadMemberPhoto (line 223)
	
 
	
	

Upload personal photo function


Upload personal photo function Assumes all security checks have been performed by this point the input file name must be called 'upload_photo' For example:
 Right: <input type='file' name='upload_photo' />
 Wrong: <input type='file' name='photoupload' /> <input type='file' name='photo' /> <input type='file' name='upload' />

	
    
				
  • return: Array consists of: final_location - final image location final_width - large image width final_height - large image height t_final_location - thumb image location t_final_width - thumb image width t_final_height - thumb image height status - status ok == true, fail == false error - error string key (ex: upload_to_big)
    • 
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		boolean/array
		
			uploadMemberPhoto
		
					([integer $member_id = 0])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				integer
				$member_id: [Optional] member id instead of current member			
    •
